Image.Text: Yo, stop right there. This Methanol is feeling some serious chemistry with you. [row] HAHA actually I already met you before! Dejavu much?
That's right. I used to be a Bromomethane before I became a Primary Alcohol. [row] Guess what I went through?

Well Spoiler Alert - I underwent Nucleophilic Substitution! [row] Primary Halogenoalkanes can react with NaOH solution under heat to yield Primary Alcohols. Reactions with Primary Halogenoalkanes is a type of SN2 reaction, where two molecules - the Halogen and Hydroxide ion - are involved in the Rate-Determining Step! [row] Got that?
Alcohol/Methanol:Great! I'll let you pick me up then. By the way, you can only have 3 chemicals following you at a time, but we'll all be visible through your INFO Journal!
HAHAHA stumped you! But seriously, just remember that SN2 Nucleophilic Substitution is: [row] Alkane + NaOH + HEAT -> Halogenoalkane.
I've got to work on my pickup lines.
